proof: Proof. By Proposition 10 and Lemma 35, there exists a real $A > 0$ such that for all $d$ large enough, whp, any connected set $|S|$ with size at least $A\log(n)/d$ has $\mathrm{degg}(S) > \frac{9d}{10}|S|$, and if furthermore $|S| \le \frac{n}{6}$, then $e_G(S) \le (1+\frac{1}{5})|S|$. To finish the proof, note that whenever $|S| \ge \frac{n}{6}$, its total degree is at least $\frac{3dn}{10}$. But whp $\frac{3nd}{10} > |E_G| > |E_c|$, giving $\frac{\mathrm{degg}(V_c)}{10} < \frac{3nd}{10} < \mathrm{degg}(S)$. Thus whenever $S$ has $\mathrm{degg}(S) \le \mathrm{degg}(V_c)/10$, then also $|S| \le n/6$, thus the exansion applies.
